rub.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to move your hand, or something such as a cloth, backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing firmly
rub.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Youâ€™ll have to rub harder if you want to get it clean.
She yawned and rubbed her eyes.
She began rubbing her hair with a towel.
rub.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to make something press against something else and move it around
rub.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: She stood by the oven, rubbing one bare foot against the other.
The cat purred loudly, rubbing against her legs.
We tried to make a fire by rubbing two pieces of wood together.
He rubbed his hands together with embarrassment.
rub.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: if shoes, clothes, or parts of a machine rub, they move around while pressing against another surface, often causing pain or damage
rub.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Badly fitting shoes are bound to rub.
The skin under my sock was rubbed raw  (=the skin had come off).
The front left fender was smashed and rubbing against the wheel.
rub.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: to put a substance into or onto a surface by pressing it and moving it about with your fingers or something such as a cloth
rub.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: Can you rub some sun cream on my back for me?
